body_content.explanation: an oily substance found naturally in human skin cells and in the liver (= an organ that cleans the blood) of sharks (= large fish with sharp teeth). It is one of the substances used to make moisturiser (= a substance put on the skin to stop it becoming dry):
examples: Squalene is present in the oil in fingerprints.
Moisturizers containing jojoba or squalene soften and smooth the skin, keeping it free of dry patches and lines, and reducing wrinkles.
